attachments.title: Vibrator Maker To Pay Millions Over Claims It Secretly Tracked Use
attachments.text: The makers of the We-Vibe, which can be paired with an app, don't admit any wrongdoing. But they will pay $3.75 million after allegations that the app was collecting "highly sensitive information."
attachments.fallback: NPR.org: Vibrator Maker To Pay Millions Over Claims It Secretly Tracked Use

text: So is this all because they didn't let users opt out of the analytics collection?
It sounds to me like someone went "analytics ALL THE THINGS!" and users were neither informed nor given an opt-out
interesting that the company chose to $ettle rather than letting it go to litigation
I think also because they collected email addresses, it could be linked to analytics after the fact
"analytics ALL THE THINGS!" would be ok without any identifying information
